jobDetails.jobDescription: Employee Applicant Privacy NoticeWho we are:Shape a brighter financial future with us.Together with our members, we’re changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.We’re a next-generation financial services company and national bank using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we’re at the forefront. We’re proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people’s lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.The RoleSoFi is seeking a Principal Product Manager to lead a key pillar of our Mortgage business. In this role, you will own and define the vision, strategy, and product roadmap for SoFi’s mortgage solutions, ensuring alignment with company objectives and our mission to help members achieve financial independence.You will develop innovative, scalable, and high-impact mortgage solutions that simplify home financing and refinancing for our members. As a strategic thought leader, you will collaborate across the organization—partnering with Engineering, Design, Finance, Sales, Operations, Capital Markets, Risk, Compliance, Marketing, and Executive Leadership—to drive business growth, optimize the customer experience, and expand SoFi’s position in the mortgage industry.This is a high-visibility, high-impact role where you will bridge the technical and business worlds, shaping the future of mortgage at SoFi. You’ll inspire with your vision and roadmap, set ambitious goals, and be accountable for delivering results. Your work will bridge the technical and business worlds, creating experiences that delight members and drive business growth.What You’ll DoOwn and define the mortgage product vision, strategy, and multi-year roadmap, aligning with SoFi’s broader financial services ecosystem.Develop and execute high-impact mortgage initiatives, optimizing loan origination, underwriting, and servicing experiences.Partner with capital markets and risk teams to influence pricing strategies, secondary loan sales, and underwriting policies.Leverage data and analytics to drive continuous improvements in conversion rates, time-to-close, and operational efficiency.Collaborate with engineering, design, and data science teams to build scalable, intuitive, and automated mortgage experiences.Influence executive leadership by presenting business cases, customer insights, and data-driven recommendations.Drive cross-functional execution by aligning marketing, operations, legal, compliance, and other key stakeholders on priorities.Communicate effectively with senior stakeholders, bringing clarity to ambiguous situations in a fast-paced, agile environmentEmbody SoFi’s values in all aspects of your workWhat You’ll NeedBachelor’s degree or higher in any discipline (technical or non-technical)7+ years of product management experience, with a proven track record of leading impactful, high-scale markets dynamicsAbility to work with executive stakeholders to align on priorities, secure resources, and drive executionData-driven decision-making expertise, with the ability to define and measure key performance indicatorsExperience building automated, scalable, and AI-enhanced financial services productsExceptional communication and leadership skills, with a strong ability to influence cross-functional teamsStrong attention to detail with the ability to summarize complex issuesExperience working with Salesforce CRM, contact center platforms, and loan operating systemsProven track Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate’s experience, skills, and location.To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page!SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.The Company hires the best qualified candidate for the job, without regard to protected characteristics.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.New York applicants: Notice of Employee RightsSoFi is committed to embracing diversity. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com.Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time.Internal EmployeesIf you are a current employee, do not apply here - please navigate to our Internal Job Board in Greenhouse to apply to our open roles.
